channel.title: New DatMaker
channel.description: Who knows which language/ how the DatMaker is run because I would like to try and add animations for arms, legs and bodies. Can anybody say project?

item.title: New DatMaker
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:19, topic:252173”]Dude, don’t gravedig, and also, no.
Just no.
That is the fixed version of datmaker which stops the error : “can not load mqo”.
What cocoa is trying to do is edit the current datmaker and add the option to animate bodies, legs, capes and arms.[/quote]

The last post before today was on the 24th. If posts on these forums lose their worth in less than 2 weeks than you might as well get rid of it.

I’ve been rendering models in visual basic for a while and it’s very hard to do (that’s how I found it, anyway). The only way I could do it is coverting the models to .X (DirectX) format (not just renaming) and using Direct3D to display them. By which point it’s hardly worth it because you might as well download DirectX Viewer. There’s no point trying to improve on DatMaker as there’s little to improve on.

Syrillia

Read full topic

item.title: New DatMaker
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

cocoa:

Who knows which language/ how the DatMaker is run because I would like to try and add animations for arms, legs and bodies. Can anybody say project?

wait roll that back…

if i do remember you saying this.

“I quit 317 coding because wl fails.”
“I quit 317 coding cause im making a 508.”

now back to 317?

lol nice anyways, plus making gfx’s and animations is relly hard.

picture it like a claymation video.

I use milkshap 3-d

make your 3-D model.

click animate.

it takes pic.

then move model.

animate.

and so on…

then play back.

edit.

put into dat.

and then put in class8.java

and then put the rest in class42.java

this will allow you to make animations.

theres lots of these softwares, but i prefer milkshape…

its because it allows you to make terrain, and other models made for you, including monster structures, and people structures, i use this for my 317 hd client

it allows me to make flashing floors, lights, tele animations.

even npc’s emotes, this way npc’s can do like matrix blocks instead of that move back

also it would take a while i have 80 gfx’s and animations and it took me 4 weeks so far…

thats because my emotes for specials aint that long, like 10 seconds.

but anyways,

you can basically make a christmas tree, with lights. and working lights burning out (christmas minigame i made)

so anyways…

good luck on your project, and i didn’t make milkshape, i just found it…and i studied it…

i might release my 317 hd client…

then i will post a tut inside for animations and gfx’s

that way others can learn the way of the wolf…

power to the cocoa!

Read full topic

item.title: New DatMaker
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:6, topic:252173”]Cocoa, i downloaded the source code a few days ago, and i had a quick look at it, and managed to find something:

procedure TMain.C_BoxChange(Sender: TObject);
begin
//combobox
   SplitFlag := False;
   TP := 255;
   If C_Box.ItemIndex <> 0 then Animate := True
   else Animate := False;
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 1 then begin Vskin := 153; Fskinval := 102; end; //blanks
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 2 then begin Vskin := 1; Fskinval := 0; end; //head
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 3 then begin Vskin := 8; Fskinval := 4; end; //Amulet
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 4 then begin Vskin := 28; Fskinval := 16; TP:= 10; end; //left hand
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 5 then begin Vskin := 50; Fskinval := 29; end; //right hand
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 6 then begin Vskin := 27; Fskinval := 15; SplitFlag := True; TP:= 10; end; //gloves
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 7 then begin Vskin := 45; Fskinval := 25; SplitFlag := True; end; //shoes

I thought that is definately something there.
I would be happy to work on a little project with you, i also do a lot of visual basics :)[/quote]

I don’t think that animates…

Read full topic

item.title: New DatMaker
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Cocoa, i downloaded the source code a few days ago, and i had a quick look at it, and managed to find something:

procedure TMain.C_BoxChange(Sender: TObject);
begin
//combobox
   SplitFlag := False;
   TP := 255;
   If C_Box.ItemIndex <> 0 then Animate := True
   else Animate := False;
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 1 then begin Vskin := 153; Fskinval := 102; end; //blanks
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 2 then begin Vskin := 1; Fskinval := 0; end; //head
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 3 then begin Vskin := 8; Fskinval := 4; end; //Amulet
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 4 then begin Vskin := 28; Fskinval := 16; TP:= 10; end; //left hand
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 5 then begin Vskin := 50; Fskinval := 29; end; //right hand
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 6 then begin Vskin := 27; Fskinval := 15; SplitFlag := True; TP:= 10; end; //gloves
   If C_Box.ItemIndex = 7 then begin Vskin := 45; Fskinval := 25; SplitFlag := True; end; //shoes

I thought that is definately something there.
I would be happy to work on a little project with you, i also do a lot of visual basics

Read full topic
